website_summaries.verdict: Does a great job with both frozen and fresh pizzas, as well as breads and baked desserts.
pros: Firebrick material provides the same heat retention as traditional pizza ovens
Resists thermal shock, so temperature changes won't result in cracking
cons: may be too large for some ovens
Among the more expensive contenders we examined

customer_reviews.title: Chemical smell permeating from stone
customer_reviews.text: Never write reviews but feel this product definitely was not sold as described. After 3 uses the smell permeating off this stone is enough to clear the house of all occupants. Don’t know how this item is sold to be food safe when it makes the dough taste like a chemical injection. Will have to really read the un paid reviews next time. Hope this helps someone
customer_reviews.author: J spell

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I've had it for several weeks now and have used it a number of times for both bread and pizza. This was the last thing I needed to make homemade pizza that I am really happy with. I had been using a metal sheet pan to bake on before this and had always been disappointed with the crust. Not anymore! The item is fairly heavy and well-made. I expect to get many years of use out of it
customer_reviews.author: GCG

customer_reviews.title: Pizza sticks to stone, funny smell
customer_reviews.text: Pizza stuck right to the stone on first use and now there are charcoal spots all over the stone. Hoping it doesn't grow mold like I've read in other reviews. Did have an odor the first few uses but havent noticed it since. Wish I purchased a pampered chef stone instead. Pizza however comes out so nice and crispy on the stone if you use parchment paper.. Update: the stone randomly started smoking everytime I went to preheat my oven. Tried cleaning it as per instructions with no change. Tired of my fire alarms going off so I am officially over this stone and am switching back to pampered chef.
customer_reviews.author: BooBravo

customer_reviews.title: The first time we heated the stone in the oven it smelled really bad. I was hoping the smell would dissipate with ...
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the positive reviews and recommendations for this pizza stone I had really high hopes. The first time we heated the stone in the oven it smelled really bad. I was hoping the smell would dissipate with use, but it did not. I even started storing the stone in the garage because it stunk up our cupboards so badly. We used it less than 10 times before we gave up. Very disappointed with this purchase and I wish I would have returned it after the first use. We decided to purchase a pizza steel and we are much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi Burmania

customer_reviews.title: Nice size for making pizza and baking multiple loaves of bread
customer_reviews.text: This is the stone that was recommended in artisan bread in 5 minutes and from many pizza people so I decided to give it a try. I have had many pizza stones and this is nice, works well and its a basic pizza stone. I don't see too much difference from the results I got from my other stones, but this one is an easy size to take out and clean. It stains just like any pizza stone but that doesn't bother me, its just a sign of a well baked life!
customer_reviews.author: Lori BelmontTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Zero Star if possible - Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: This thing off-gasses so badly when heated that it stinks up the house with a terrible burnt plastic smell. Used it more than once with same effect. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Followed instruction perfectly but has bad odor
customer_reviews.text: I rinsed the stone with water, wiped it dry with paper towel and let it air dry for 24 hours on a rack. Pre-heated the oven to 500 ... Placed bread dough on parchment paper ... then in oven on the stone. No food, oil or fat touched the stone. The smell is not the parchment paper because I followed the same procedure on a cast iron skillet with no smell. The odor was not that strong but cast iron has no smell and retains heat very well. Returning the stone.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Acey

customer_reviews.title: Terrible chemical smell does not go away.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE! I BOUGHT THIS IN JUlY,IT IS NOVEMBER STILL SUCH A STRONG CHEMICAL SMELL COMES FROM IT EVERY TIME I US IT..
customer_reviews.author: cynthia

customer_reviews.title: If your stone has a strong chemical smell exchange it ...
customer_reviews.text: If your stone has a strong chemical smell exchange it for a different one right away. I got the replacement with NO smells at all. Flawless exchange with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Briant Daniel

customer_reviews.title: warped in middle
customer_reviews.text: bought this and set aside since i wasn't using right away... when i pulled it out of box i noticed it was warped.. didn't see return time had passed.. still used it for small flatbread pizza but afraid to use for a large pizza since the cheese did melt and travel a bit on the stone..
customer_reviews.author: mmac

customer_reviews.title: crispy crust
customer_reviews.text: received my pizza stone - made a few pizza's on it already. does a very nice job in drying out the bread so you get a nice crisp crust. excellent size for my home oven. use if often and very happy with the quality
customer_reviews.author: urmoney

customer_reviews.title: Great Pizza Stone
customer_reviews.text: No surprises, no odor, does not rock on rack as some reviews state,I had some smoking for 1st 5 minutes but may have been oven debris. Much easier to get food on stone with 14 X 16 size vs round. I made a pizza and a calzone yesterday and they both came out great. Also fits perfectly on my infrared grill. This was listed on a site as the best pizza stone. I have no comparison but also no regrets and some stones go for over $100.00 for the price it could very well be the best buy
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: its garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Used twice, the fumes are horrendous. My eyes are burning and my head hurts and had windows and doors open airing out the house on a zero degree night. I had a pampered chef pizza stone for years which finally broke and NEVER had trouble with fumes. Skip this one, its garbage.
customer_reviews.author: bryan kelliher

customer_reviews.title: Too deep for a standard 30" wide oven
customer_reviews.text: This is heavy. Arrived in perfect condition and very well packaged. Unfortunately was too deep for a standard 30" oven without having it sitting on the angled part of the rack :( upgraded my stove to a 40" wide oven (not for the sone mind you) and was still too deep. Will try utilizing it outdoors on a fire pit grill this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Christyn

customer_reviews.title: it works better than expected, and even improved everything else I bake in the oven!
customer_reviews.text: Not only does this thing bake an amazing pizza out of a cheap cheap cheap old oven (see photos) that can just barely contain it, it has also unexpectedly improved the quality of EVERYTHING I cook in my oven! What a nice surprise that just by having this thing in the oven I can now bake fluffy biscuits! I can assume it has something to do with keeping a better regulated oven temperature, maybe, I don't know, but I can't buy a better pizza than I'm baking now in my cheap old oven, and other foods I bake are now so much better!
customer_reviews.author: Haggard

customer_reviews.title: Odor so terrible, I don't believe this is Cooks' Illustrated recommendation
customer_reviews.text: The odor produced by this stone is terrible. my main regret is that I make pizza infrequently enough that I didn't realize how awful it was before the return window closed, and now I'm stuck with this heavy piece of garbage. I bought this thinking that it was Cook's Illustrated's recommended stone, but I think I must have been mistaken. This seems to be under the same name ("Old Stone Oven") but not clear if it's actually sold by that manufacturer. Based in the horrible results and the way it's made my pizza crust inedible, I'm willing to bet this is not the real deal. Would love some clarification about whether the name is truly as misleading as it seems.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Lenzo

customer_reviews.title: Unless you are Dwayne Johnson, IT'S TOO HEAVY
customer_reviews.text: Dwayne, you are good to go. or if you do 10 reps of 50 lb curl them maybe. First off this is a MONSTER. large, TALL and HEAVY. now put a pizza on it. my wife can barely put it in the oven using two hands. I had to struggle with a one handed insert of the huge object. it's also tall and will not fit in by broiler. I should have sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Larsen

customer_reviews.title: A HORRIBLE STONE!
customer_reviews.text: This pizza stone is completely worthless. I'm not sure how it got nearly 5 stars because it is an inferior product. It has to be seasoned and even then dough wants to still stick to it and It leaves a strange taste on what you cook. We've used it since Christmas so 3 months now and it hasn't gotten better.
customer_reviews.author: Bec

customer_reviews.title: Crispy pizza! Crunchy bread! Yum!
customer_reviews.text: The stone is heavy and hard to clean. It makes lovely rustic bread and pizza. And that is what I bought it for. I don't leave it in the oven because it blocks the heat when I am baking something in a pan that is not set right on the stone. It has a coarse surface and pizza cheese burns right to it and then when I wash it, it is stained black. Not pretty. It does work as advertised and the price and delivery were good.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: Pizza Night Every NIght
customer_reviews.text: The stone arrived intact, double boxed with ample packing materials. We have used it 4 or 5 times to great success. We leave it in the oven and when necessary clean it with sandpaper. The pizzas are cooked through with crispy bottoms. So far, this has been our best investment in home made pizzas. We did buy a pizza paddle locally and find it to be very useful, esp with placing the prepared pizza on the stone. Be sure to warm the stone for 1 hour before cooking the pizza. A great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jamowa

customer_reviews.title: Broke while cooking
customer_reviews.text: Mine snapped in half while cooking a pizza on grill. It also started to look burned (top and bottom) and impossible to get clean. Reached out to vendor multiple times but have received no response. Going to go with a pizza steel next as the stone is just too fragile
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a pampered chef pizza stone. No pre/heating it, it was smooth, seasoned beautifully. However, this stone sucks. It’s rough like particle board. Sharp and scrapes your counter, it’s heavy, the food sticks to it and it smells like chemicals. I’m sending mine back.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Fitch

customer_reviews.title: This baking stone is fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: If you READ THE DIRECTIONS, and first rinse the stone on BOTH sides; dry it with paper towels; let it sit on the counter for a day; set in a cool oven then raise the stone and oven to 350° for ~a half hour; turn the oven OFF and leave the stone in the oven to cool SLOWLY to room temp; then you can bake on it beautifully with no oder or breakage. I really like this big stone!
customer_reviews.author: Valking5

customer_reviews.title: Stone wicks all over in oven during use and makes a mess out of oven!!
customer_reviews.text: Stone wicks all over in oven during use and makes a mess out of oven!! For the first couple of months it worked great but then it started wicking all over in the bottom of the oven. We have to clean our oven after using it every time. It does it when cooking pizza, cookies, and other goods. No worth the investment!
customer_reviews.author: Jake Bair

customer_reviews.title: Regulates Oven Temperature Smoothly
customer_reviews.text: I use my stone in various ways but in particular, to regulate the temperature of the oven. When I am doing a beef roast or roasting a bird in the oven, this is always in there. I find that my temperature stays up more consistently and gradually tapers off much more smoothly than without it. There are only a few items that I make in the oven where I will find myself removing it, but there are very few. At this price, you cannot go wrong with purchasing this for your oven. I actually came across it in Cooks Illustrated where they highly recommended it, and they have never steered me wrong. Get ready to be impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Hyperion

customer_reviews.title: a Christmas gift to myself
customer_reviews.text: I broke my Old Stone baking stone several years ago after leaving it in my oven when I ran the self-cleaning cycle. It was a clean break--the 2 pieces fit together exactly, but a single stone would have been simpler to deal with. When Amazon put the stone on sale at a wonderful price, I decided to gift it to myself for Christmas. The new stone looks just like the old one and I hope it gives me as much good service as the original.
customer_reviews.author: jkim

customer_reviews.title: Great results so far
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, I was a little worried about some of the comments I read but needed a new stone so decided to give this a try. Item arrived well packed and in one piece unlike some that stated item arrived broken or chipped. Plan on using this on outdoor grill but have only used it in the oven so far with great success. Also seen some complain about how long it took to heat up, hey, it's stone, they all take time and I guess that the most important thing, take you time, follow the instructions for use and you'll enjoy the results.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Goodpizza stone for the money
customer_reviews.text: It was good while it lasted, i dropped the stone in less than 3 inches from the floor landing patially on my foot and broke on one side. Be careful this clay is delicate after all. If only the clay was fire treated to make it stronger it would be better. Baked my pizza and calzones perfectly. Cleaning after first use was a cinch. I only wished that it came with a reusable storage case, but i was able to recycle the delivery box into a padded storage case. I know some of the users indicated that there was a bad odor from the stone, I did not find this to be true with my stone.
customer_reviews.author: Beto62

customer_reviews.title: Old Stone Oven Round Pizza Stone
customer_reviews.text: It's heavy...but I just leave it in the oven, durable, haven't cleaned but it doesn't smoke! Much better than the cheap imitations...have a care when moving it...they are handmade pottery....and can be subject to too much force.
customer_reviews.author: jdy

customer_reviews.title: Valuable tool for my kitchen/oven
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. It takes a few minutes to get it up to heat, but once it is, it does a great job of maintaining the temp. Not only is it great for getting sustained heat under a pizza crust and giving it that nice crunch, but for breads, rolls and other things too. Also really great for keeping things warm without burning them up in the oven! I usually just leave it in there to help maintain the heat even when I'm NOT actively using it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Good, but wobbly
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it promises. The only thing is, I may have received a faulty one, because mine wobbles when placed on a flat surface. It has raised areas on the bottom, I'm guessing for airflow and such, but the raised portion in the center is raised slightly more than all the other areas, making it wobble.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Miller

customer_reviews.title: Love this pizza stone!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stone! I just leave it in the oven all the time with no problems/worries- doesn't effect cooking other things. When I want to cook a pizza I pre-heat to 500 and when I'm ready to put the pizza in the oven, turn the oven down to 475. I use parchment paper under my dough to easily slide the pizza onto the stone, let it cook 5 minutes, remove the parchment, let it cook 5 minutes more and get a perfect pizza every time. Great size for a standard dough ball.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Whiteknight

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I’m really bummed because I love pizza and my fiancé and I eat pizza three times a week or so. I bought this as a Christmas gift for him and when cooking with the stone it stinks up my whole house! It’s like a chemically smell. I suffer from chronic migraine and can’t let him cook with it anymore because it messes with my sense of smell so bad.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Odor
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewers are correct about very bad smell. I regret purchasing this pizza stone and will be looking for another one. I would recommend you look someplace else.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for bread
customer_reviews.text: I like it, but contrary to the suggestion of leaving it in your oven when not using it, I find that things don't brown as well as when the stone is out of the oven. It does a lovely job with bread and that's all I care about, and I don't mind having it sitting on my stovetop when not using it. Be sure to measure your oven rack to determine which size stone is right for you. The raised bit of the rack at the back will prevent the stone from going to the back of the oven so measuring the oven itself is a bit misleading.
customer_reviews.author: suzjohnson

customer_reviews.title: Great for RV Ovens
customer_reviews.text: We live in an RV and use a propane oven. One problem is that there is a hotspot in the middle of the oven which results in cookies being burned in the middle and undercooked on the edges. This pizza stone works great for removing the middle hotspot, but make sure there's enough room around the edge of the pizza stone to allow adequate circulation.
customer_reviews.author: Dee NTop Contributor: Amazon Echo

customer_reviews.title: Great for baking bread
customer_reviews.text: I use this stone for baking bread. It works better than a round "pizza" stone because I can put more loves on this stone. The bread browns evenly and the crust is crisp. The Italian bread recipe included with the stone is easy and tastes good.
customer_reviews.author: MargaretW

customer_reviews.title: Just didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: Didn't do much to improve my pizza game. And then food got burnt onto it, so now I can't just store it in the oven because when I heat the oven, there's a weird smell that comes from it. It's bulky & heavy and now I regret buying it. (Doesn't mean the product is bad; probably is user-error, though I've tried many tips and tricks).
customer_reviews.author: Kellygrace

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: All the pizza crust recipes I tried suggested a pizza stone. I kept using an aluminum pan with sub par results. I finally found a great crust recipe and decided to invest in a stone. The results have been incredible! I’m finally getting great quality pizzas at home. My family is thrilled. I also use it for baking breads. The stone is large and easy to work with. I leave it in the bottom of my oven. This was a great investment,
customer_reviews.author: boyandgirl

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this pizza stone. With this I can finally make "restaurant" size and quality pizzas at home. Kids have taking in to calling me Pizza dad and are always excited when I break this stone out. So far the pizzas made using this stone compare favorably to even pizza hut, according to the kids. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Tommi

customer_reviews.title: This square was round
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my sister for Christmas because I broke hers the year before. I had a hard time finding a square pizza stone so I was excited when I saw it on here. The problem was even though I ordered a square stone I still got a circle!
customer_reviews.author: Josh Dufresne

customer_reviews.title: Not for cookie baking.
customer_reviews.text: Just received my stone today. It’s a very heavy stone but quality is nice. I washed the stone with water before using. But I’m very disappointed that my cookies turned out horrible. I’ve used a pizza stone for my cookies for years and they always turn out beautiful. I’m sure it’s great for a pizza and bread but that’s it. Don’t buy this for anything other then baking pizza or bread.
customer_reviews.author: Darla

customer_reviews.title: Darn good stone!
customer_reviews.text: I’m someone who is a review nut. I’ll read probably 50-100 reviews (most recent ones) until I buy a product like this. I can honestly say, that I have had no bad experiences so far. I’ve made about 12 pizzas, #13 is currently in the oven. Each one has come out just as good as the last. I cleaned it twice and actually sanded the top surface at work with a 1000 grit pad. This thing is a great buy. If anything changes I’ll update, but I don’t think I’ll have to.
customer_reviews.author: Rich C.

customer_reviews.title: Patience. Temper your stone before use
customer_reviews.text: If you temper the stone properly. The chemical smell will go away. I started at 200 for half hour 250 half hour and so on till 500. Then let it sit in there. Next day repeated the process. I’ve had to temper professional brick pizza ovens before. Just takes a little time.
customer_reviews.author: James Patrick Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Great all around stone.  Using it for pizza with good results.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stone, I use it almost exclusively when I use the oven. The directions cautiously warn against using anything with grease or fat in it, this is only for bread. I have defied this warning with good results. The first several uses caused the whole to wreak of burning grease, but the stone is now seasoned. Remember to wash with HOT water after each use. The dark marks indicate that it is becoming seasoned. We use it for pizza (fresh, frozen, and reheated delivered), fries (frozen and fresh cut tossed in oil), asparagus. Pretty much anything. It works quite well.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE - This is NOT the ATK best-choice stone
customer_reviews.text: I specifically ordered the Old Stone 14x16 stone as it was best-choice on ATK. ATK liked it because it had raised feet. What arrived was NOT an "Old Stone" and did NOT have raised feet. See pictures. Bit of a bait and switch. Ticks me off - totally not right. Returned to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Seaskills

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I love to make homemade pizza and usually make one every week or so. We have had one of these stones for years and it has been great. We got another one just like it so we can make two at once if company is coming over. Of course it gets stained over time but it doesn't affect the performance. I use a metal scraper and a brush with metal bristles to clean it when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mel White

customer_reviews.title: Makes perfect pizza!
customer_reviews.text: This pizza stone is the key to my amazing pizzas. It fits well in my oven and cooks the crust beautifully. Make sure you pre-heat it in the oven for at least half an hour (an hour is better). After trying it in different oven positions, I now use it on the bottom rack. A large pizza cooks at 500 degrees in six minutes. I frequently spill things on it (I make calzones a lot and sometimes they leak), which makes an ugly mess. I scrape and scrub off what I can, and while what is left is ugly, it doesn't transfer to the pizza.
customer_reviews.author: Amy O.

customer_reviews.title: After following all manufacturers directions, the stone did not ...
customer_reviews.text: After following all manufacturers directions, the stone did not cook the pizza properly at all. The crust stuck to the stone and after it cooled the stone molded. Stone was only rinsed and scrubbed with water and left to dry.
customer_reviews.author: LMD

customer_reviews.title: My husband is our pizza maker, and when our ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband is our pizza maker, and when our old stone cracked through the middle I thought he was going to cry. I ordered this one for him and he really loves it. I was worried that it is heavier, but that doesn't matter to him. We haven't had it long, so I can't speak to durability, but i have high hopes!
customer_reviews.author: FY

customer_reviews.title: certain ones like diogiornos (sp) with lots of toppings dont cook in ...
customer_reviews.text: takes a while to heat up, heavy, but gets the job done. even if you cook frozen pizzas, certain ones like diogiornos (sp) with lots of toppings dont cook in the center before the crust starts to burn. this solves that. leave it in the oven a while before cooking cause it takes a while to heat up. personally i leave mine in the oven at a very high temperate for 30 minutes before turning it down to pizza temp and cooking on it.
customer_reviews.author: reymundo figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Thick, heavy, durable, seems to heat evenly
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a cheap, thin, circular stone I bought from BB&B which cracked in half after about 18 months. This stone is thick, heavy, seems to heat evenly. I've been using this product for a few months now and I'm quite satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Just A Review

customer_reviews.title: This product stinks, literally.
customer_reviews.text: This stone emitted the worst stink into our home. We tried it for months, because the pizza we cooked on it was great. But the stench ultimately outweighed the result and when I tried to return it, the vendor and/or Amazon said the time was up for returns. This product stinks, literally. I wanted to give it a zero rating because stink was so bad, but had to give it one star. We hated it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: stones are great
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a pampered chef that was 25 years old and cracked. I am not sure that I like the legs on the bottom. It makes it hard to turn in the oven if needed. It isn't seasoned yet so doesn't have the awesome taste fact. Since it is new, it is a little hard to get clean. No better way to make pizza. the 500 degree rating is crucial.
customer_reviews.author: sshetler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality but very heavy
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit that I lost my urge to make my own pizza after using it only once. This is a great size, excellent quality but a little too heavy for me to use. I do "store" It right in my oven all of the time, a definite advantage, so it does not require any extra space in my rather small house.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene

customer_reviews.title: This stone bakes great pizza from frozen or scratch
customer_reviews.text: This stone bakes great pizza from frozen or scratch. It does take extra time to preheat your oven as the stone absorbs heat. It is great for the price and is made in the U.S.A. of U.S.A sourced materials. If you are cheap and looking for a "quarry stone" I suggest going out to your yard and finding the nearest stone large enough to cook a pizza. You can cook an egg on your cars engine block but I would rather cook my eggs on my range. As I would much rather bake my pizzas on this stone in my oven.
customer_reviews.author: Seth H.

customer_reviews.title: It helps make pizza, what more do you need?
customer_reviews.text: My pizza game has gone up a notch with this stone. Its heavy. Mine is now stained but still works. I just leave mine in the oven all the time. It does take a little longer to preheat the oven with it in, but its worth the great pizza.
customer_reviews.author: S. Kantz

customer_reviews.title: Improve your pizza baking
customer_reviews.text: Now I realize what my homemade pizza was missing: sufficient bottom heat to crisp the crust. Seven minutes is all the time needed to bake the best pizza in town. I leave the stone on the bottom oven rack; it even enhances cookie baking.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cole

customer_reviews.title: The pizza stone received is not the one pictured
customer_reviews.text: I have the exact same pizza stone for years (not bought on amazon) and I ordered a second one so I use it for outdoors only. I received a smaller size than what the original is, and does not have the bottom legs (it's basically flat on both sides). Not sure what's going on... Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Jatinder

customer_reviews.title: Using this stone in my grille the crusts come out nice and crisp
customer_reviews.text: I am using this stone to make pizzas in my gas grille. I used to cook pizzas in my gas oven on a baking sheet. But the crusts would often be soggy in the middle. Using this stone in my grille the crusts come out nice and crisp, just the way I like them. I had to reduce the temperature down about twenty-five degrees from what I usually bake at.
customer_reviews.author: Say Wha?!

customer_reviews.title: Could not ask for more
customer_reviews.text: My wonderful bf got this for me as a Christmas present a year ago, and I'm just now getting around to reviewing it. It's recommended by CI, which should tell you something. I love this stone- good size and weight, perfect for baking homemade pizzas and breads. Simply wonderful. Some things to keep in mind: 1. I make the pizza on some parchment paper and bake the pizza on it, so it's easier to move around. 2. I prefer to let my stone preheat with our oven- it should be in there for at least 45 mins before you start cooking, to make sure the crust is nice all the way through.
customer_reviews.author: tohru1@myspace.com

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Pizza stones are ment to get dirty lol so funny other reviews on how it got stained and such if it’s not dirty your not using it right!! Love making calzones/ pizza on this!! Also I have a small oven and this fits so perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: I Dislike It All  Around
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy, too heavy to heat up and then remove in order to get a pizza on it. Heavy to remove from oven when cooking is done. Does not crisp the bottom of the pizza. I am very unhappy with it and plan of going back to what I had before for years before it was broken
customer_reviews.author: Linda K Feldbin

customer_reviews.title: Works well, no smell
customer_reviews.text: I was worried when I read people's complains about smelly pizza stones. I have not noticed any smells and I have a "too" sensitive noise. I've made 4-5 home made pizzas over the past few weeks and it's worked great.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Soggy pizza
customer_reviews.text: Does not work well. The bottom of pizza is always soggy, top burns before bottom is cooked. Do not recommend. I'm throwing mine out.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Martincic

customer_reviews.title: The product arrived broken and I could not get another one!
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived broken and I could to get another one!

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Smell!!!
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware! Complete garbage! I'd give this zero stars if I could. Absolutely terrible smell when heated. Takes a good 1/2 to get rid of the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Maple Leaf

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very solid pizza stone that works great. It's big, so barely fits in our oven but works GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Garrett

customer_reviews.title: pizza cooked correctly
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. I was a little hesitant because of the price, but the texture and taste of each pizza I have cooked on it make it worth it. I used to either cook on a cookie sheet or directly on the oven shelf. This stone cooks each pizza just perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie Clark

customer_reviews.title: Complete and utter garbage...
customer_reviews.text: This pizza stone is absolute GARBAGE. Followed all the directions before using and the pizza was stuck to the stone. Worst purchase ever. Bought 3 of these for an interactive pizza making party and it did not end well. Horrible experience.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Bando

customer_reviews.title: No odor, yes it stains, great pizza stone!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about the strong odor comments before ordering. But NO, no odor whatsoever. Maybe a slight swiff of smell first time heating up, for a very short period of time. Once starting using, stains occur. I expect that. I saw a superb YouTuber chief (xiaogao jie)using the same kind of pizza stone, and hers has stains too. My oven goes as high as 525F. It takes around 6 minutes for my pizza to get a golden topping color. The flavor indeed is different than without a pizza stone. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Take pizzamaking to the next level!
customer_reviews.text: Allows oven to make great pizza. Here's a tip: when cooking pizza at 500 in oven, put pizza on parchment paper for 2 minutes, then like a magician, rip the parchment paper from underneath the pizza and BOOM! no calzone pizza, just excellent stuff. Does get dirty, hard to clean, heavy, will scratch any surface you put it on. AWESOME product.
customer_reviews.author: !Easy E!

customer_reviews.title: Loser
customer_reviews.text: Chipped all the way around so will not be using it. Plus, way too heavy and big.
customer_reviews.author: My Two Cents

customer_reviews.title: why did this crack  at first time using it., was a gift daughter just called me?????
customer_reviews.text: this was a gift and daughter just called Why did this crack at first time using ????
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Lyford

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: This stone is just too stinky to use. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: but I have owned pizza stones that are much thicker and seem to made of a better quality! If you would like a light weight ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a 'nice' stone, but I have owned pizza stones that are much thicker and seem to made of a better quality! If you would like a light weight pizza stone, this is certainly the choice, but if you are looking for durability, I recommend that you keep looking!
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Off gassing when heated
customer_reviews.text: i have used this stone twice and it has stunk up my home twice. I have never had a prior pizza stone do this. Will have to send it back... really wanted this stone to work but due to whatever the off gassing the stone is doing, need to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still using today with no issues at all Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased another brand first but returned due to Qulity control. My wife used to have the pizza stones from Pampered Chef but after so many years they would crack or break...she wasn't happy! So, when she wanted to make her healthy pizzas and needed another stone we decided to go to Amazon and look for a replacement that seemed to have good reviews and we found this Old Stone 16 inch round stone. She keeps them in the oven and takes them out whenever they need to be rinsed clean. She loves this brand and has not had any problems with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mcgyver210

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: MEASURE YOUR OVEN! Mine has the kind of racks that make it impossible to fit in it. It fits on the floor of the stove but I am concerned about it interfering with heat circulation. I've only used it once so I'll have to add an edit to this one later.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I expected a foul odor at first
customer_reviews.text: I've used this twice for French bread in the last week. I followed the directions before first use. I expected a foul odor at first, after reading reviews. The only odor I experienced was the residue in the oven from previous baking. I use this, typically, at 450° and with steam. I love this stone!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing pizza stone
customer_reviews.text: I returned this pizza stone. It is very heavy and bulky. Once I opened the package, I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: JoEllen Sarff

customer_reviews.title: holding up well
customer_reviews.text: own it a couple months now no issue with cracking of smell not sure why so many complain about the smell followed the direction on seasoning it works great
customer_reviews.author: Tiger 1

customer_reviews.title: Great Stone!
customer_reviews.text: We use this puppy on the grill outside on our deck or indoors in our kitchen oven. No fuss! The more you use it the better it gets...It's a great investment for bakers that love to bake pizzas and artisan breads.
customer_reviews.author: Moondoggie

customer_reviews.title: Useful stone
customer_reviews.text: Convenient. I keep this on the top rack of the oven at all times. It is great for heating things up without a dish - like leftover pizza and sandwiches (as long as they aren't messy - one doesn't want to mar the stone), as well as for making fresh breads, pizza, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Anstice

customer_reviews.title: Pizza stone broke
customer_reviews.text: I have had this pizza stones since July I believe. It has been sitting in my oven I just took it out I scraped it off and rinsed it?picked it up to put it back in the oven and it broke?
customer_reviews.author: cindy simms

customer_reviews.title: Awful smell
customer_reviews.text: used this stone about 6 times now. Doesn't make any difference between the crusts that were on a baking sheet and 6th time I used it created an awful smell that will not go away. Like burning plastic. What a waste
customer_reviews.author: Lin

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR MY NEEDS
customer_reviews.text: makes great pizzas in my oven, cant clean no matter what i do, says i cant have it in the oven when i self clean. new to pizza making so my stone is virtually black. it doesnt seem to effect the pizzas i make
customer_reviews.author: CoInAZ

customer_reviews.title: The Secret To Great Pizza Crust!
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to preheat this stone on the lowest possible rack... and you will be rewarded with the best pizza crust you can make at home! Use parchment paper beneath your dough while cooking and you will never have a clean-up problem. Best investment ever for pizza! kj
customer_reviews.author: Pam J.

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and works well
customer_reviews.text: These are a little bit fragile. They work well though. Just leave it in the oven to avoid breakage. Unfortunately, doing that requires a 45 min preheat to get even oven heating.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L. Witt

customer_reviews.title: Sticky, stinky mess....
customer_reviews.text: From day one, everything sticks to this stone...hard to clean, stinks when heated....after trying for over 30 day, still stunk up house....nothing burning to make smell, just had a chemical smell. Just tossed....a waste of $$$ - major disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Gas fumes
customer_reviews.text: We almost died the first and only time we use this product, it released this powerful gas fumes to the point we had to evacuate our home.
customer_reviews.author: Ru hefner

customer_reviews.title: This was a reorder.  Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: We loved our pizza stone. A relative "borrowed" it and fell in love with it. So we "gifted" the original and reordered the stone for ourselves. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: kb

customer_reviews.title: Good stone, does the job nicely.
customer_reviews.text: I bought to cook pizza in a conventional oven. I've used it about a dozen times and so far it is holding up and cooks pizza's nicely. Just follow the instructions on care and storage and you will have a long lasting pizza/baking stone. Notably, you will get stained from grease and cheese melting on it so there's not much you can do other than scrap what you can off. This is normal. The stone is pretty heavy and I suspect it will break even at the slightest drop so be careful not to drop it.
customer_reviews.author: Phu Ngo

customer_reviews.title: Pizza Hot Out of the Oven
customer_reviews.text: Works great and cooks your pizza like real pizza from a shop. Heats it on the stone. No burnt bottom. Heavy solid stone. Looks nice works better
customer_reviews.author: Xpaphil

customer_reviews.title: Not for direct food use
customer_reviews.text: Really difficult to clean. I don't recommend putting anything directly on this. It does however work well when putting it on the bottom rack and a metal pizza pan with pizza on the rack above it. Helps even the heat and keeps the pizza dough from burning or getting too crispy.
customer_reviews.author: Ely

customer_reviews.title: Delicious homemade pizza
customer_reviews.text: As a pizza stone, it will stain but will be clean. I keep it in the oven almost all the time because it helps keep the oven temperature stable, and works great when baking pies atop.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Still the Best for Bread
customer_reviews.text: After many, many years of dependable, work horse service, our old stone finally did wear out, and after doing extensive online research, in the end we decided to get the same model. Classic no frills, great size, substantial enough to hold the heat well and evenly, but not too thick so that it's too heavy to handle. I expect we'll get another 10 years out of the new one! We do use it for baking bread mostly, with the occasional pizza thrown in, so there may be some stones designed for pizzas that are round, or glazed, that we skipped over... so if you want a stone JUST for pizza, then there may others more appropriate for you.
customer_reviews.author: Scythia

customer_reviews.title: perfect price and size!
customer_reviews.text: This thing ROCKS! Haven't taken it out of my oven since December 26th. It works for pizza, chicken tenders and pretty much everything else I make for my family of 5. I highly recommend this well priced stone!
customer_reviews.author: AudreyBlake_

customer_reviews.title: Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to clean, but a must have for those that make their own pizzas and want that pizza restaurant taste and crust.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Like the fact that it has "feet" is raised up for easier handling . This stone is huge you can make a large pizza on it
customer_reviews.author: PATTYCAKE

product_meta.title: Old Stone Oven Rectangular Pizza Stone
product_meta.description:
Size:14" x 16"| Color:natural clayWhere there’s a party, there’s pizza—and tonight the party’s in your kitchen. It doesn’t matter if the only guests are this Old Stone Oven Rectangular Pizza Stone, a bottle of Valpolicella and you in your finest sweatpants. You’ll be making pizzeria-worthy pies with delightfully textured crusts. In the blink of an eye, this large pizza stone bakes up your dough, draping it in a gooey blanket of cheese you can wrap yourself up in or actually eat. The best part? In addition to being the best pizza stone for your oven, it doubles as the best baking stone for happenin’ bread parties, too.

AMAZON.COM
Professional pizza and traditional European bread ovens are often lined with stone or brick. This is so heat is stored up and redistributed evenly. The resulting blast of heat from the Old Stone Oven rectangular pizza stone gives bread and pizza a nice chewy crust. The rustic French tarts called galettes are also well suited to a baking stone. To use the stone, place it in a cold oven and preheat to 500 degrees for pizza, or according to the recipe for bread or galettes. The stone is made of the same material that lines blast furnaces and kilns, so it can handle ultra-high temperatures. 

 Wait until the baking stone is entirely cooled before attempting to clean it. Let it dry completely before using again. Some discoloration will occur over time; this is natural and will not affect baking. Using baking parchment may help delay that discoloration. Do not bake cookies, turnovers or other high-fat items on the stone; the stone would absorb the fat and proceed to produce smoke and bad odors. The stone comes with a flyer that contains detailed use and cleaning instructions, as well as recipes for bread, pizza dough, and two pizza toppings. --Garland Withers
feature_bullets: Baking stone creates restaurant-quality pizzas and breads
Absorbs heat and transfers it evenly for a perfect bake
Durable, non-cracking; crafted from a blend of lead-free clays
Specially engineered Heat Core eliminates soggy centers
